item.title: Settlement with S.H. Bell Requires Manganese Emission Safeguards at Plant in Ohioville, Pa. and East Liverpool, Ohio
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (January 18, 2017) -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the U.S. Department of Justice today announced a proposed consent decree with S.H.
item.dc:creator: Region 03

item.title: EPA Provides Two Universities with $4 Million for Drinking Water Quality Research
item.description: WASHINGTON - Today the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced approximately $4 million in funding to two universities to research water quality issues related to low flow conditions of drinking water in premise plumbing systems.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

EPA Awards $900,000 to Pennsylvania to Protect Wetlands

item.title: EPA commemorates America Recycles Day with $12,000 grant to West Chester Univ. for composting
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (November 15, 2016) – In recognition of America Recycles Day, the U.S Environmental Protection Agency today announced a $12,060 grant to West Chester University to support a food composting project that will help the university and West Chester Borough keep food scra
item.dc:creator: Region 03

item.title: Pa. Department of Transportation settles western Pa. underground storage tank violations with EPA
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (October 18, 2016) – The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation (PADOT) will pay a $26,066 penalty for underground storage tank violations in Brownsville and Franklin, Pa. where facilities stored diesel fuel.
item.dc:creator: Region 03

item.title: EPA to award $820,000 brownfields grant to Philadelphia to assess and clean up abandoned industrial, commercial properties
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (September 28, 2016) – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency today announced an $820,000 brownfields grant to support the assessment and cleanup of abandoned industrial and commercial properties in Philadelphia.
item.dc:creator: Region 03

item.title: OMNOVA Solutions Inc. reaches settlement with EPA over toxic chemical violations
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (August 16, 2016) – OMNOVA Solutions, Inc. will pay a $7,090 penalty as part of a settlement with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Region 03

item.title: EPA awards $750K grant to Carnegie Mellon Univ. to advance air monitoring technology
item.description: PHILADELPHIA – (August 12, 2016) -- Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced a $749,945 grant to Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh to develop an air monitoring research project to help improve air quality and human health in Pittsburgh neighborhoods.
item.dc:creator: Region 03

item.title: EPA Awards $4.5 Million to Advance Air Monitoring Technology
item.description: WASHINGTON – Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced grants to six research organizations to develop and use low-cost air pollution sensor technology, while engaging communities to learn about their local air quality.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Region 01, Region 03, Region 04, Region 07, Region 09, Region 10
